item.title: A French Foreign Ministry Official Reads a Sensitive Email Not Initially Addressed to Him
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2025-04-21_1030_0800_read_receipt_by_samuel_belbachir.pdf From: Samuel BELBACHIR (samuel.belbachir@diplomatie.gouv.fr) Subject: Read: Open Letter â€“ Formal Request for Transmission to the Diplomatic Post (Grave Danger Reported) Date sent: April 21, 2025, 10:30 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Vincent Le Corre Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2025-04-21_1030_0800_read_receipt_by_samuel_belbachir.pdf ðŸ“Œ Why this email read receipt matters An official email reporting a serious and substantiated threat was sent on April 19, 2025, to multiple high-ranking French and Chinese authorities, including a French senator, diplomats, intelligence services, and journalists.

item.title: Mortal Danger in Beijing, China â€“ Open Letter to Pierre Mirochnikoff, President of the Union of French Citizens Abroad
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2025-04-19_2306_0800_lettre-ouverte-demande-formelle-de-transmission-au-poste-diplomatique-danger-grave-signale.pdf From: Vincent Le Corre Subject: Open Letter â€“ Formal Request for Transmission to the Diplomatic Post (Grave Danger Reported) Date sent: April 19, 2025, 23:06 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Pierre Mirochnikoff (personal email address) Cc: French Senator Ronan Le Gleut (r.le-gleut@senat.fr), The State Council of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China (premier@mail.gov.cn), Yves Strickler (French law professor), Chinese journalist ä½•è’¨ (HÃ© QiÃ n), alleged by French intelligence sources to have engaged in espionage or influence operations on behalf of China (email address: @163.
